basics.name: Alysha Fujitani
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the College of Engineering  at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2020. After graduation, I hope to have a career in cybersecurity.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
Chaminade University of Honolulu, Honolulu, HI

work.summary: Learn important engineering skills related to transporation
highlights: Researched, wrote, and delivered a Memorandum of Understanding between HART and other City departments
Learned about different fiber connections and cybersecurity problems related to Rail

work.summary: Spread and label moths, butterflies, and fruit flies
highlights: Create expeditions about collections in the museum and post them onto digivol.com
Prepare microscope slides with fruit fly wings and legs for further observations
Pin, label, and photograph fruit flies

work.summary: Validation of fingerprint methods for the Scientific Investigation Section
highlights: Validated various fingerprint powders such as black powder, magnetic powder, and flourescent powder
Validated various solutions used to retrieve fingerprints from adhesive surfaces
Applied different methods of lifting fingerprints with various substrates

volunteer.organization: Caring Crocheters, Chaminade University of Honolulu
volunteer.summary: Crocheted baby blankets for the New Parent Support Program (NPSP)
highlights: Helped families on base who did not have supplies for babies

volunteer.organization: Forenisc Science Club, Chaminade Univsersity of Honolulu
highlights: Participated in IAAS Girl Scout Community Service Day
Helped at the Science Fair held by the American Chemistry Society
Learned more techniques used in Crime Scene Investigation

awards.title: Second place
awards.summary: My team won second place in 2017.  See my portfolio site for more details.
